metadata.value: Sermones sancti Bernardini de senis ordinis fratrum minorum de euangelio eterno.
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: A page of the written record of the sermons of Bernardini da Siena printed before 1500, giving us insight into incunabula and the world of early printed books. Illustrated capitals begin paragraphs and ornamentation is also seen. Johannes Amberach, the publisher, is known for using Roman type instead of classic Gothic or Italian types. He was concerned with the art of his works and was a hugely followed humanist in his time around Basel. This piece was acquired by the Edinburgh College of Art because of its contribution to typography.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Binding: preliminary gatherings bound at end. Bound in late twentieth-century buckram. Title and Dewey number tooled in gilt on spine: "Sermons Bernard of Senis...". With pairs of circular rust stains at centre head of leaves of gathering [pi], probably from the fittings for a chain from a chained library, on lecterns. Preliminary gatherings therefore removed to the end of the volume in rebinding.
